docs.text: Welcome! I am a graduate student of the Geophysics Program in the Earth, Atmospheric and Planetary Sciences ( EAPS ) department at MIT. My work, supervised by Michel Campillo , focuses on observing the collective behavior of earthquakes to better understand faults and fault structures. A large part of this work is dedicated to developing the methods necessary for identifying the many small earthquakes in our study regions, namely automated earthquake detection and location methods. As seismology is now entering the realm of data science, because of the large volumes of data that are now available, I also explore the possibilities offered by machine learning algorithms and see if we can do better than traditional techniques. Other Websites Research Gate GitHub Google Scholar Contact Information ebeauce@mit.edu 77 Massachusetts Avenue Building 54 - office 527 Cambridge, MA, 02139 USA

docs.text: Earthquake catalog from Beaucé et al. 2019: Catalogs are given as h5 files. Origin times, locations and P/S-wave travel times given per template: catalog_Beauce_et_al_2019_per_template Origin times, locations and P/S-wave travel times of the 17,293 earthquakes presented in Beaucé et al. 2019: catalog_Beauce_et_al_2019 The origin times should be read with the UCTDateTime function from obspy! Let me know if these links are broken, or if you have any question.

docs.text: 2019 Eric Beaucé , William B. Frank, Anne Paul, Michel Campillo and Robert D. van der Hilst. Systematic Detection of Clustered Seismicity Beneath the Southwestern Alps. Journal of Geophysical Research: Solid Earth . DOI: https://doi.org/10.1029/2019JB018110 cf. section Material for downloading our earthquake catalog. 2017 Eric Beaucé , William B. Frank and Alexey Romanenko. Fast Matched Filter (FMF): An Efficient Seismic Matched‐Filter Search for Both CPU and GPU Architectures. Seismological Research Letter . DOI: https://doi.org/10.1785/0220170181 FMF is available at https://github.com/beridel/fast_matched_filter
